post.content:
Following Job just opened in my department. If you are interested, please send your resume and covering letter to me at suh.l@sympatico.ca.

=====================================================================
Job Title: Engineer/Officer - System Software Development and Support
Hours of work: 35.00
Location: 49 Sargeant Drive, Barrie

General Accountabilities:

Full life cycle support of software for the Integrated Operating Facilities used in the real-time monitoring and control of the Transmission system.
Design, develop, and implement software modules using established procedures and practices.
Analyze performance of integrated systems and their components.
Provide technical support for software developers and end users.
Investigate and resolve failures at the software and operating system level.
Develop procedures and standards required for the secure operation and management of Transmission/Distribution information systems.

Selection Criteria

Essential Competencies:
Demonstrated strong personal commitment to high quality work and customer satisfaction.
Demonstrated ability to develop and deploy complex real-time tools required for transmission operations.
Demonstrated ability to work in a project environment, under tight deadlines, interfacing with other project staff, as well as users and project leader.
Demonstrated ability to assess, develop, recommend and implement integrated solutions.
Ability to work effectively as part of a large multi-disciplined team.
Demonstrated record of self-motivated behaviour and perseverance to accomplish objectives.
Demonstrated ability in planning and maintaining control of quality and work performance.
Demonstrated extensive hands-on experience with life cycle computer tool support.
Professional level of communication skills, both oral and written.
Demonstrated capability to deal with external vendors.

Essential knowledge, Experience and Qualifications:
Demonstrated experience in successful design and implementation of robust software.
Experience in a real-time control system environment would be an asset.
Demonstrated proficiency in one or more programming languages, including: C/C++, Java, and/or Visual Basic.
Experience in developing multi-threaded high performance software.
An understanding of multitasking operating systems and TCP/IP networks.
Requires an advanced knowledge of electrical engineering/computer science subjects and disciplines in order to design, develop and support large-scale real-time and mission critical computer systems. This knowledge is normally acquired through the completion of four years of University training.
A period of up to 8 years experience in software lifecycle management is required.

Notes:
Applicants with lesser qualifications will also be considered at the lower salary level.
